info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 5:40PM EDT until August 11 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Lexington, Newberry and Richland.
* WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 540 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lexington, Newberry, Red Bank, Prosperity, Newberry College, Dreher Island State Park, Newberry County Airport, Chapin, Little Mountain, Pomaria, Silverstreet, Peak, Mid-Carolina High School, Fairview Fire Station, Stoney Hill, US-176 and SC-34 Crossroads, Newberry County Detention Center, Rocky Point Recreation Area, Melvin Park and Putnam's Landing. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 66 and 94. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 55 and 56. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don't drown.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Lexington, SC; Newberry, SC; Richland, SC
